We teased you yesterday, but no more monkeying around…here’s the recipe for Monkey Punch!

This tasty cocktail recipe has been created by Erik Lorincz from Kwānt, No.47 in The World’s 50 Best Bars 2019, with Monkey Shoulder whisky. Will you be giving it a try?

𝐈𝐧𝐠𝐫𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬
25ml Monkey Shoulder
25ml Calvados
10ml Mezcal
10ml oloroso sherry
50ml oat milk
5g zatar
15g demerara sugar 
Garnished with floregano •
Video by @50bestbars
#tw50bc #theworlds50bestcocktails
#Worlds50BestBars #50BestBars #Cocktail #Bar #London #Recipe #CocktailRecipe #Bartender #UK #whisky @monkeyshoulder @kwantlondon @eriklorincz

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @servedbysoberon 

Diffords Top 100: SHAFT (62/100)
- 60ml/2oz Cold Brew Coffee
- 30ml/1oz Vodka
- 30ml/1oz Bailey's
- 15ml/0.5oz Coffee Liqueur
- - - - -
HOW: Shake all with ice / Strain over fresh ice / Garnish optional.
- - -
RATING: 3.5/5
- - - - -
When it comes to sweet drinks, there is an important distinction to make.👆 On one side you have cocktails that wrongfully lack either acidity or bitterness (and, hence, are unbalanced ⚖️); on the other side, there are cocktails that deliberately have a 'sweet flavor profile' 🤗.
.
While Friday's 'San Francisco' was a prime example of the former 🥴 (and ultimately tasted as exciting as yesterday's newspaper that got soaked in fruit juice🤭😖), today's 'Shaft' belongs to the latter category, meaning that, yes, I actually, genuinely, was very much into this drink 👏.
.
Landing somewhere between an Espresso Martini, a White Russian and a Screaming 0rg4sm (am I doing it right? 🤣), the Shaft is a pretty delicious after-dinner cocktail.☕️ It's heavy on the coffee, it has a velvet texture thanks to the Cream Liqueur and is lifted in ABV due to the Vodka.🍹 The result is like a Mocha on Steroids, it's not a complex cocktail, but as far as creamy drinks go, ticks most, if not all, necessary boxes 💯.
.
Drinkstagram ❤️ anybody else who loves after-dinner cocktails?
- - - -

𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @recipesbydebbie 

BLUEBERRY AND GINGER🫐🫐🫐 

I took this shot awhile back when irises were in bloom. It was a creation based on colour! Cheers to trailway finds, wild flowers, and purple cocktails!🥂🍹💜
Recipe:
1 1/2 oz @dixonsdistilledspirits Wicked Blueberry Gin 
3/4 oz @giffard_liqueurs_syrups Ginger of the Indies 
1 oz lemon juice 
1/4 oz homemade @regattacraftmixers Ginger Beer syrup
1/4 oz homemade butterfly pea flower syrup 
1/2 oz egg white 
Pinch of @spirainc Blue Spirulina powder
Pinch butterfly pea flower powder 
Dry shake, then shake with ice. Serve in a coupe glass and garnish with a purple iris!

Amor Eterno: ❤️

𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @thebitterfairy 

From the moment I saw this on @servedbysoberon's feed, I couldn't wait to make it. I had to make a few substitutions, but the bones are the same: this is a pine-y gin sour with icy blue glacial vibes, and I absolutely loved it! Next time I might go with rosemary rather than mint, to echo that pine-y sensibility. The mint was lovely, though.⁣
⁣
Glacial Sour⁣
⁣
2 oz gin⁣
3/4 oz Supasawa⁣
2/3 oz simple syrup⁣
1 barspoon pine liqueur⁣
dash woodland bitters⁣
Electric Sky Spirulina powder⁣
⁣
Shake all except spirulina powder and strain over crushed ice. Garnish with spirulina powder and herbs.⁣

𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @highproofpreacher 

It’s been a minute since I’ve had a good swizzle! I saw this recipe was from the great @apday of @deathandcompany so I knew it had to be good. It’s a Sherry-based play on the classic Queen’s Park Swizzle– and it’s bomb. Please excuse me while I go and make another one… 

Coffey Park Swizzle 

1 oz Rhum Barbancourt 3 Star
1 oz Lustsu Amontillado Sherry
¼ oz Velvet Falernum
¾ oz fresh lime juice
¾ oz ginger syrup
3 dashes Angostura bitters 

Add ingredients to a shaker (except the bitters) and whip shake. Strain into a Pilsner glass filled with crushed ice and swizzle until cold. Top with more crushed ice as needed, then add bitters. Garnish with fresh mint. 

Recipe📕: @apday / @deathandcompany

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @baseldrinks 

"DON'T JUDGE A BOOK BY IT'S COVER" 

That's a lesson I should've learned by now, unfortunatelly you already know I didn't and I still do judge a book by it's cover and 99% of the time I am right 😁 but there are also rare moments like this one when I just have to admit that I WAS WRONG ! 

I am not a big fan of blue cocktails and I can count on the fingers of one hand the blue cocktails that I like,  they look great and they taste way too sweet (extremely sweet 😬) but then, I saw this take on the "Corpse Reviver no.2"  one of my favorite classic cocktails and that was something I had to try even though I was skeptical, but adding a bit of color and a tropical touch to this already amazing cocktail makes it more desirable and it also takes the taste to a new direction, one that I strongly recommend you to try ! 

VIPER REVIVER 

30 ML DRY GIN
15 ML BLUE CURAÇAO LIQUEUR
15 ML LILLET BLANC
15 ML FRESHLY SQUEEZED LEMON JUICE
15 ML PINEAPPLE JUICE
ABSINTHE TO RINSE
GARNISH : PINEAPPLE LEAF 

Shake all the ingredients with ice then strain into an Absinthe rinsed Coupe glass (chilled) or (like me !) into a rocks glass over 1 large ice cube.
Garnish with the pineapple leaf. 

Note : rinse and discard the Absinthe excess 

Cheers🍸 and don't forget
SAVE IT if you LIKE IT !

𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @thebittergringo 

How about some smoke to start the week? 

Recipe: 

2 parts Cardenal Mendoza Brandy
½ part Braulio Amaro
½ part Lapsang-Souchong Sherry*
4 dashes Amargo Chunco Bitters 

Garnish: Rosemary Smoke 

Method: 

Stir the cocktail ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass. Strain into a well-chilled cocktail coupe. Using a smoking device, add rosemary smoke to the cocktail. If you do not have a smoking unit, just torch a fresh rosemary sprig over the cocktail, and enjoy!

node.text:
𝑻𝒉𝒂𝒏𝒌𝒔 𝒕𝒐 🍸 @thehobbydrinkchef 

We’re back with another instalment of #soundtrackmyfriendsdrink - the community challenge hosted by Adam @soundtrackmydrink - and for the fourth edition, we’re honouring musicians that have passed away. 

I was assigned the song ‘Needled 24/7’ by Children of Bodom from @denisgor . This Finish heavy metal band was fronted by Alexi Laiho, an absolutely amazing guitarist. When I was younger, and much much better at guitar than I am these days, Alexi was definitely viewed as one of the best guitarists, and I was never even close to being able to pull off any of his songs. Unfortunately he passed away earlier this year at the age of 41. Even more unfortunate is that he died of liver degeneration due to years of alcohol abuse. Dam. How do you make a drink to honour someone who literally died from drinking? Well… you try really hard to use no alcohol! I also chose to incorporate a few ingredients that have proven health benefits for improving liver function, something that we should all be mindful of, given the niche that we’re in. 

The song itself speaks about betrayal, being “burned” way too many times. So yeah, we had to do some fire elements for this one, and while we’re at it, why not just make it a black cocktail, the song and band are pretty dark, after all! 

CATCHING FIRE
2oz Seedlip Grove 42
3/4oz Matcha Green Tea Syrup
3/4oz grapefruit juice
1/2oz lime juice 
2 dashes of hot pepper bitters
1 barspoon of agave syrup
1 barspoon activated charcoal 
Absinthe for flames 

Rim a rocks glass with sea salt/black lava salt and set aside. Add all ingredients to a shaker tin with ice and shake. Strain into the rocks glass over fresh ice, then garnish with the spent lime. Add a sugar cube soaked with absinthe, set on fire, and sprinkle with cinnamon to let the flames go wild!! *watch the eyebrows*

⁣
Lavender Smoke⁣
⁣
1 1/2 oz mezcal⁣
3/4 oz Cerulea gin⁣
1 oz lime juice⁣
3/4 oz lavender syrup⁣
few drops saline⁣
⁣
@nudeglass from @remy_savage_⁣
